In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

In Julia, you can use the Dates package to manipulate date-time data. Below is a function `add_yearmonth` that performs this task:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.year(df[:dt]) * 100 + Dates.month(df[:dt])
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym`. The value in this new column is the year of date `dt` multiplied by 100 and then added to the month of date `dt`, which gives us a four digit number representing the year and month.

You can use it like:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[]) # create an empty dataframe with DateTime column
push!(df, (DateTime("2021-05-15"),)) # add some data to df
add_yearmonth(df) # call the function
```
